citations.narrative:
In an enclosure housing ring-tailed lemurs, there is an exposed electrical cord. Unprotected electrical cords can cause
potential injury or death to the animals contained within the enclosure. The facility must ensure all enclosures safely
contain the animals and protect them from injury or harm. Correct by 6/12/2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
On March 18, 2023, a 3-day old, tufted capuchin died as a result of injury by a conspecific, per facility records. Upon
interviewing facility representatives, it was revealed the animal was found with bite wounds on its body. Primates,
especially infants and young juveniles, have complex social and environmental needs. Failure to address these needs
can result in stress and poor outcomes. Correct from this day forward (5/11/23) by working with the Attending Veterinarian
to address the needs of infant primates.

The free-range portion of the park housing sable, blackbuck, and one white bearded gnu/wildebeest contained PVC pipes
used for construction, an electrical box, as well as access to a large propane tank.
In the enclosure housing anteaters, there are two sections of the wire fence that are no longer buried leaving gaps
between the fence of the primary enclosure and the ground.
Unsound primary enclosures that are not maintained in good repair may lead to injury if they do not safely contain the
animals. The facility must ensure all enclosures safely contain the animals and protect them from injury or harm. Correct
by 6/12/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility director and assistant director.
Additional Inspectors:
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n

narrative:
3.75(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
In an enclosure housing ring-tailed lemurs, there is an exposed electrical cord. Unprotected electrical cords can cause 
potential injury or death to the animals contained within the enclosure. The facility must ensure all enclosures safely 
contain the animals and protect them from injury or harm. Correct by 6/12/2023. 
3.81(a)(3)  Critical
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
On March 18, 2023, a 3-day old, tufted capuchin died as a result of injury by a conspecific, per facility records. Upon 
interviewing facility representatives, it was revealed the animal was found with bite wounds on its body. Primates, 
especially infants and young juveniles, have complex social and environmental needs. Failure to address these needs 
can result in stress and poor outcomes. Correct from this day forward (5/11/23) by working with the Attending Veterinarian 
to address the needs of infant primates. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
The free-range portion of the park housing sable, blackbuck, and one white bearded gnu/wildebeest contained PVC pipes 
used for construction, an electrical box, as well as access to a large propane tank. 
 
In the enclosure housing anteaters, there are two sections of the wire fence that are no longer buried leaving gaps 
between the fence of the primary enclosure and the ground.  
 
Unsound primary enclosures that are not maintained in good repair may lead to injury if they do not safely contain the 
animals. The facility must ensure all enclosures safely contain the animals and protect them from injury or harm. Correct 
by 6/12/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility director and assistant director.

Additional Inspectors: 
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n
